description: Defines in which direction the animation is played.

Hello
World

description: Defines how long the animation has to wait before starting. The animation will only be delayed on its first iteration.

example.code:
Hello
World
example.title: animation-delay: 0s;
example.description: The animation will wait zero seconds, and thus start right away.

name: animation-delay

description: Defines how long the animation lasts.

example.code:
Hello
World
example.title: animation-duration: 0s;
example.description: The default value is zero seconds: the animation will simply not play.

name: animation-duration

description: Defines what happens before an animation starts and after it ends. The fill mode allows to tell the browser if the animationâ€™s styles should also be applied outside of the animation.

example.code:
Hello
World
example.title: animation-fill-mode: none;
example.description: The animation styles do not affect the default style: the element is set to its default state before the animation starts, and returns to that default state after the animation ends.

name: animation-fill-mode

description: Defines which animation keyframes to use.

example.code:
Hello
World
example.title: animation-name: none;
example.description: If no animation name is specified, no animation is played.

name: animation-name

description: Defines if an animation is playing or not.

example.code:
Hello
World
example.title: animation-play-state: running;
example.description: If the animation-duration and animation-name are defined, the animation will start playing automatically.

name: animation-play-state

description: Defines how far the background should extend within the element.

example.code: Hello world

name: background-clip

description: Defines the color of the element's background.

example.code: Hello World

description: Defines how the background image will behave when scrolling the page.

name: background-attachment

Hello
World

example.title: padding: 0;
example.description: Removes all paddings.

name: padding

description: Defines if the textarea is resizable or not.

example.title: resize: none;
example.description: The textarea is not resizable.

name: resize

description: Defines if the element reacts to pointer events or not.

example.code:
Hover me

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam semper diam at erat pulvinar, at pulvinar felis blandit.
example.title: pointer-events: auto;
example.description: The element reacts to pointer events, like :hover or click.

name: pointer-events

description: Defines the position behavior of the element.

example.code:
Ancestor container

Target element
position: static
Child element
position: absolute
right: 5px
top: 5px
example.title: position: static;
example.description: The element will remain in the natural flow of the page.

name: position

description: Defines the position of the element according to its right edge.

example.code:
Parent container

Natural position
Actual position
example.title: right: auto;
example.description: The element will remain in its natural position.

name: right

description: Defines how the text content of the element is horizontally aligned.

example.code:

example.title: text-align: left;
example.description: The text content is aligned to the left.

name: text-align

description: Defines how the text content of the element is decorated.

example.code: Hello world
example.title: text-decoration: none;
example.description: Removes any text decoration.

name: text-decoration

description: Defines the indentation of the element's first line of text.

example.code: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam semper diam at erat pulvinar, at pulvinar felis blandit. Vestibulum volutpat tellus diam, consequat gravida libero rhoncus ut. Maecenas imperdiet felis nisi, fringilla luctus felis hendrerit sit amet.
example.title: text-indent: 0;
example.description: The text is not indented.

name: text-indent

description: Defines how the hidden text content behaves if it's overflowing.

example.code: Hello world
example.title: text-overflow: clip;
example.description: The text content is clipped and not accessible.

name: text-overflow

description: Defines the shadow of the text content.

example.title: text-shadow: none;
example.description: The text content has no shadow.

name: text-shadow

description: Defines the position of the element according to its top edge.

example.code:
Parent container

Natural position
Actual position
example.title: top: auto;
example.description: The element will remain in its natural position.

name: top

description: Defines how long the transition lasts.

example.code: Hover me
example.title: transition-duration: 0s;
example.description: The transition will last zero seconds, and is thus instant.

name: transition-duration

description: Defines how the text content should be transformed.

example.code:
Hello world!
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam semper diam at erat pulvinar, at pulvinar felis blandit. Vestibulum volutpat tellus diam, consequat gravida libero rhoncus ut. Maecenas imperdiet felis nisi, fringilla luctus felis hendrerit sit amet.
example.title: text-transform: none;
example.description: Removes any text transformation: the text will appear the same as in the HTML code.

name: text-transform

description: Defines the origin for transformations defined by the transform property.

example.code: Hello world
example.title: transform-origin: 50% 50% 0;
example.description: The transform origin is in the center of the element.

name: transform-origin

description: Defines how long the transition has to wait before starting.

example.code: Hover me
example.title: transition-delay: 0s;
example.description: The transition will wait zero seconds, and thus start right away.

name: transition-delay

description: Defines how the element is transformed.

example.code: Natural position
example.title: transform: none;
example.description: Removes any transformation.

name: transform

description: Defines which properties will transition.

example.code: Hover me
example.title: transition-property: all;
example.description: The element will transition all properties:

name: transition-property

description: Defines how the values between the start and the end of the transition are calculated.

example.code: Hover me
example.title: transition-timing-function: ease;
example.description: The transition starts slowly, accelerates in the middle, and slows down at the end.

name: transition-timing-function

description: Shorthand property for transition-property transition-duration transition-timing-function  and  transition-delay.

example.code: Hover me
example.title: transition: 1s;

name: transition

description: Defines how an inline or table-cell element aligns vertically.

example.code: Some text before some text after.
example.title: vertical-align: baseline;
example.description: The element is aligned with the baseline of the parent.

name: vertical-align

description: Defines the width of the element.

example.code: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam semper diam at erat pulvinar, at pulvinar felis blandit. Vestibulum volutpat tellus diam, consequat gravida libero rhoncus ut. Maecenas imperdiet felis nisi, fringilla luctus felis hendrerit sit amet.
example.title: width: auto;
example.description: The element will automatically adjust its width to allow its content to be displayed correctly.

name: width

description: Defines how the element's white space is handled.

example.code: #parent .selector ul li blockquote{ color: red; font-size: 1rem; }
example.title: white-space: normal;
example.description: Sequences of spaces are combined into one.Line breaks are ignored.The text content is wrapped.

name: white-space

description: Defines which properties are expected to change in the future (either through CSS or JavaScript).

example.code: Hello world
example.title: will-change: auto;
example.description: Doesn't tell the browser to optimize any property.

name: will-change

description: Defines the spacing between words of a block of text.

example.code: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog
example.title: word-spacing: normal;
example.description: The spacing between the characters is normal.

name: word-spacing

description: Defines how words should break when reaching the end of a line.

example.code: Thequickbrownfoxjumpsoverthelazydog
example.title: word-break: normal;
example.description: Words with no space will not break. Sequences of uninterrupted characters will be displayed on a single line.

name: word-break

description: Defines the order of the elements on the z-axis. It only works on positioned elements (anything apart from static).

example.code:
One
Two
Target
Three
Four
example.title: z-index: auto;
example.description: The order is defined by the order in the HTML code:

name: z-index
